dataset.title: Main experiment Site B: initial monitoring herb layer -total cover, herb cover

creator.organizationName: Department of Biology, College of Life and Environmental Sciences, Wenzhou University
Department of Biology, College of Life and Environmental Sciences, Wenzhou University

abstract.para: This data gives cover values of herbs in each of the 1 mu subplots of the experimental site B of the BEF-China experiment.
This investigation has done before weeding, and the plants are in the best growth period.

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: Find the list of keywords here: http://china.befdata.biow.uni-leipzig.de/keywords
List of headers of the data columns in this dataset

intellectualRights.para: for the data owner and pi of sp11 (Ask the data owner if you can use this data.)

taxonomicClassification.commonName: This data gives cover values of herbs in each of the 1 mu subplots of the experimental site B of the BEF-China experiment.

description.para: Main experiment Site B: initial monitoring herb layer -total cover, herb cover
This data gives cover values of herbs in each of the 1 mu subplots of the experimental site B of the BEF-China experiment.
This data gives cover values of herbs in each of the 1 mu subplots of the experimental site B of the BEF-China experiment.

samplingDescription.para: Each 1 mu plot in the initial plot map in the report to the German Science foundations was visited and a W-Transect was used to inspect tatal herb cover.
The herb composition can be related to soil and relief variables (altitude, slope, aspect). It can also be used as covarible in further analysis of the plot

dataTable.entityDescription: Main experiment Site B: initial monitoring herb layer -total cover, herb cover

attribute.attributeName: Numeric treatment acronyms for the main experiment (plot number), id
attribute.attributeDefinition: Numbers lower than 100 belong to 4 mu plots, while numbers from 100 on are 1 mu plots. Within the 4 mu plots, the 1 mu plots have different shrub treatments. These are indicated by the subscript. Shrubs in the main experiment were planted: 1 - no shrubs, 2 - 2 shrub species , 3 - 4 shrub species, 3 - 8 shrub species (plot number: plot number of the plot in Site B)

textDomain.definition: Numbers lower than 100 belong to 4 mu plots, while numbers from 100 on are 1 mu plots. Within the 4 mu plots, the 1 mu plots have different shrub treatments. These are indicated by the subscript. Shrubs in the main experiment were planted: 1 - no shrubs, 2 - 2 shrub species , 3 - 4 shrub species, 3 - 8 shrub species

description.para: Numeric treatment acronyms for the main experiment

Numbers lower than 100 belong to 4 mu plots, while numbers from 100 on are 1 mu plots. Within the 4 mu plots, the 1 mu plots have different shrub treatments. These are indicated by the subscript. Shrubs in the main experiment were planted: 1 - no shrubs, 2 - 2 shrub species , 3 - 4 shrub species, 3 - 8 shrub species
plot number of the plot in Site B

attribute.attributeName: Vegetation layer cover (total vegetation coverage), percent
attribute.attributeDefinition: Estimated cover when looking from above. Cover can be estimated in percent, but there are also ordinal classifications of cover, such as Londo or Braun Blanquet. ---- Londo vegetation cover works in levels, so that 1 ≤ 1 % cover; 2 > 1 to ≤ 3% cover; 4 > 3 to ≤ 5% cover; 10 > 5 to ≤ 15% cover; 20 > 15 to ≤ 25% cover; 30 > 25 to ≤ 35% cover; 40 > 35 to ≤ 45% cover; 50 > 45 to ≤ 55% cover; 60 > 55 to ≤ 65% cover; 70 > 65 to ≤ 75% cover; 80 > 75 to ≤ 85% cover; 90 > 85% cover---- Cumulated vegetation cover ist calculated as: To combine T1 and T2 (both in %) you simply use the formula T_total = T1 + T2 * (100-T1)/100 ---- For example: T1 = 50% and T2 = 50% give T_total = 75%. (total vegetation coverage: total cover estimated to 1 percent)

description.para: Vegetation layer cover

Estimated cover when looking from above. Cover can be estimated in percent, but there are also ordinal classifications of cover, such as Londo or Braun Blanquet. ---- Londo vegetation cover works in levels, so that 1 ≤ 1 % cover; 2 > 1 to ≤ 3% cover; 4 > 3 to ≤ 5% cover; 10 > 5 to ≤ 15% cover; 20 > 15 to ≤ 25% cover; 30 > 25 to ≤ 35% cover; 40 > 35 to ≤ 45% cover; 50 > 45 to ≤ 55% cover; 60 > 55 to ≤ 65% cover; 70 > 65 to ≤ 75% cover; 80 > 75 to ≤ 85% cover; 90 > 85% cover---- Cumulated vegetation cover ist calculated as: To combine T1 and T2 (both in %) you simply use the formula T_total = T1 + T2 * (100-T1)/100 ---- For example: T1 = 50% and T2 = 50% give T_total = 75%.
total cover estimated to 1 percent

attribute.attributeName: Vegetation layer cover (herb vegetation coverage), percent
attribute.attributeDefinition: Estimated cover when looking from above. Cover can be estimated in percent, but there are also ordinal classifications of cover, such as Londo or Braun Blanquet. ---- Londo vegetation cover works in levels, so that 1 ≤ 1 % cover; 2 > 1 to ≤ 3% cover; 4 > 3 to ≤ 5% cover; 10 > 5 to ≤ 15% cover; 20 > 15 to ≤ 25% cover; 30 > 25 to ≤ 35% cover; 40 > 35 to ≤ 45% cover; 50 > 45 to ≤ 55% cover; 60 > 55 to ≤ 65% cover; 70 > 65 to ≤ 75% cover; 80 > 75 to ≤ 85% cover; 90 > 85% cover---- Cumulated vegetation cover ist calculated as: To combine T1 and T2 (both in %) you simply use the formula T_total = T1 + T2 * (100-T1)/100 ---- For example: T1 = 50% and T2 = 50% give T_total = 75%. (herb vegetation coverage: total cover of herb estimated to 1 percent)

description.para: Vegetation layer cover

Estimated cover when looking from above. Cover can be estimated in percent, but there are also ordinal classifications of cover, such as Londo or Braun Blanquet. ---- Londo vegetation cover works in levels, so that 1 ≤ 1 % cover; 2 > 1 to ≤ 3% cover; 4 > 3 to ≤ 5% cover; 10 > 5 to ≤ 15% cover; 20 > 15 to ≤ 25% cover; 30 > 25 to ≤ 35% cover; 40 > 35 to ≤ 45% cover; 50 > 45 to ≤ 55% cover; 60 > 55 to ≤ 65% cover; 70 > 65 to ≤ 75% cover; 80 > 75 to ≤ 85% cover; 90 > 85% cover---- Cumulated vegetation cover ist calculated as: To combine T1 and T2 (both in %) you simply use the formula T_total = T1 + T2 * (100-T1)/100 ---- For example: T1 = 50% and T2 = 50% give T_total = 75%.
total cover of herb estimated to 1 percent
